c74object.name: cage.transp
c74object.description: Transposes all the content in a bach.roll or bach.score.

objarg.name: transp
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the initial transposition amount in cents or as a pitch (defaults to C0)

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs result of the last transposition.

method.name: float
method.description: Any number in the right inlet sets the transposition amount in Cents.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the inlet is considered as the roll or score gathered syntax. The transposition operation is performed and the transposed roll or score in gathered syntax is output through the outlet. The output header content is the same as the input header content. The amount of transposition is set via the right inlet (defaults to 0), and an llll in such inlet is converted into a float or a pitch.

method.name: pitch
method.description: Any pitch in the right inlet sets the transposition interval.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
